basics.name: Daniel Price
basics.summary2: Senior Backend Developer with a passion for solving interesting problems with elegant solutions. Happiest developing in AWS using Node.js/Typescript, Serverless and Terraform but always looking to learn something new. Currently looking for my next opportunity.

work.name: WonderBill
highlights: Designed architecture for generating, dismissing and removing in-app notifications on the server-side, enabling any changes to be synced across multiple devices.
Modularised Serverless code in order to standardise components and guarantee that appropriate alerting and monitoring is in place by default.

Simplified and reduced costs of services responsible for communicating with third-party communication services (e.g. Mixpanel, Customer.io) by replacing redundant transform Lambda functions with EventBridge transformers.

Secured sensitive user data by encrypting DynamoDB tables with KMS keys restricted to specific execution roles. Permissions were granted to developers in sub-production environments in order to facilitate debugging.
Ensured user financial data was never more than six hours out of date by implementing a Step Function to refresh data for a user and automatically handle any consent issues.
Conducted sprint standups, storymapping sessions and user interviews.
skills: AWS (Appsync/GraphQL, Cognito, DynamoDB, Lambda, EventBridge, Step Functions)

work.name: Chameleon Technology
highlights: Led a team of eight programmers using Agile methodology to develop (both code and infrastructure), test, deploy and monitor the cloud system responsible for more than 75,000 IoT devices.
Built new functionality under a serverless event-driven architecture, primarily made up of SQS queues to communicate between Lambda functions and persisted data using DynamoDB.
Advocated for clean codebase applying SOLID principles, avoiding duplication by extracting functionality into packages and encapsulating implementation details.
Promoted increased test coverage through unit testing using Jest, end-to-end testing using Gauge and load testing of new functionality before going live.
Improved the teams’ existing infrastructure of Docker, Terraform and Bitbucket Pipelines to ensure consistent builds, tests and deployments across environments .

Owned the development of a new app which consumes and transforms data from IoT devices, and delivers the serialized (Protobuf) data to the appropriate external Kinesis stream, assisted external partners in integrating with the app and coordinated integration testing before Go Live.
Orchestrated data migration and checking of 10 million row IBM DB2 database to AWS Aurora (MySQL) instance including on-the-fly transformation of data.
Mentored colleagues through code reviews and established coding standards and best practices.
Conducted interviews for new developers.

work.name: TPP
highlights: Delivered the full development lifecycle of clinical software including one of the primary applications used by UK healthcare professionals to provide real-time access to 50 million electronic patient records.
Advanced proficiency in Java OOP design principles through designing, developing and testing front and back end functionality in a fast-paced collaborative environment.

Regularly queried and updated one of the world’s biggest online SQL databases (1.7 petabytes), which required a solid understanding of indexes, stored procedures and database structures and the ability to analyse execution plans in order to optimise queries on large datasets.
Designed and implemented mobile architecture to allow protocols defined by clinicians to be downloaded by patients on Android and iOS apps.
Improved user-input validation for a public-facing website for reporting safeguarding concerns.
Travelled to Qatar to meet government ministers and gather development specifications for new functionality for the Workers’ Welfare programme for the 2022 World Cup.
Devised and delivered recruitment events which included presenting to over 200 attendees.
Trained new developers by delivering talks on programming basics, and performing code reviews.
Organised the assignment of developers to project teams ensuring suitable allocation of resource and experience.

work.name: Brathay Trust
highlights: Developed a streamlined and simplified process for data collection, entry and evaluation, to standardise and enhance the quality of data.
Researched and implemented digital data collection techniques, creating a system which automatically generates bespoke online surveys from an online spreadsheet.

work.name: The Sick Children's Trust
highlights: Wrote press releases and sold in to media; one featured in a newspaper double-page spread.
Conducted phone interviews with families in order to write stories to be published in magazines and online.
Secured Cambridge TV coverage by telephone of ‘Family Fun Day’ fundraising event.

work.name: Perm State University
highlights: Co-authored a paper based on my research into a new synthetic methodology for synthesising heterocyclic compounds based on a novel strategy.
Presented literature seminars on methods in organic synthesis.
Tackled geological problems of Pre-Urals during a two-week International Summer Seminar.
Independently developed website to publicise tutor group information, editable by non-technical team members
Managed social media presence and mailing list of over 750 people
Tutored GCSE science weekly to 5 students with student-run volunteering scheme to inspire academic confidence, interest and attainment
Organised training from Red Cross to allow team to deliver first aid workshops to over 100 people.
Delivered presentation to 700 students to encourage attendance at workshops.
Designed and sold wristbands to raise £300 for training and increase awareness of charity.
Earned Diana Award for outstanding contribution to community
